description:
## Join a Compassionate Healthcare Environment Are you a dedicated healthcare professional seeking to make a meaningful impact in mental health care? This physician-owned and led psychiatric practice offers both remote and in-person services in a supportive and collegial atmosphere. We're proud of our strong team culture, having maintained a zero turnover rate since our inception. We invite skilled professionals, including M.D.s, D.O.s, Psychiatric Nurse Practitioners, and Physician Assistants, to consider joining our growing team. ### Why You Should Consider This Opportunity
  • Flexible Schedules:** Enjoy the freedom to work as often or as little as you want, accommodating your personal needs.
  • Competitive Compensation:** Benefit from industry-leading pay that reflects your expertise.
  • Comprehensive Support:** Access supervision and consultation when needed, ensuring you never feel alone in patient care.
  • Efficient Workflow:** Experience a streamlined work environment without lengthy meetings or complicated documentation processes.
  • Work-Life Balance:** Pursue a fulfilling career while maintaining a healthy personal life.
  • Community Impact:** Contribute positively to the lives of patients through high-quality mental health care.
  • Prescribing Autonomy:** Work with minimal controlled substance prescriptions and without pressure to prescribe certain medications.
  • Positive Work Culture:** Join a professional and supportive environment that fosters growth and collaboration.
  • Focus on Care:** Our excellent support staff handles all administrative tasks, allowing you to concentrate on your patients.
  • Transparent Compensation:** There are no confusing metrics—your earnings are clear and straightforward.
  • Complete Coverage:** We fully cover malpractice insurance, licensing fees, and continuing education costs.
  • No After-Hours Requirements:** Dedicate your focus to patient care during your scheduled hours without on-call demands.
  • Strong Community Reputation:** Align with a practice recognized for its outstanding service and integrity.

### Position Overview We are seeking a Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant with psychiatric experience for a part-time role, with the potential for full-time growth. In this position, you will evaluate, develop, and treat individuals, families, and teenagers through both in-person and telemedicine services. Responsibilities include comprehensive mental health assessments, diagnoses, and medication management, with collaboration among medical and mental health professionals. ### Key Responsibilities Patient Care Management & Documentation

  • Conduct thorough evaluations to establish diagnoses and create effective treatment plans.
  • Adhere to ethical medication management practices.
  • Maintain patient confidentiality and privacy.
  • Document clinical encounters accurately and promptly.
  • Employ various treatment methodologies and counseling techniques.

Consultation & Referral

  • Seek consultations as necessary to ensure optimal quality of care.
  • Facilitate ethical decision-making processes.

Patient Education

  • Educate patients and their families using effective teaching-learning strategies to encourage positive health outcomes.

Communication & Team Collaboration

  • Identify system-specific issues and collaborate with colleagues to enhance office operations.
  • Actively participate in continuous improvement initiatives.

### Skills & Qualifications

  • Strong independent clinical decision-making abilities.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Team player with a collaborative mindset.
  • Proficiency in electronic medical records (EMR) systems.

### Requirements

  • **Experience:** Minimum of two years of post-graduate experience in a behavioral health setting.
  • **Education:** Master's degree from an accredited nursing or physician assistant program.
  • **Licensure & Certification:** Current NP or PA license in California without disciplinary actions; DEA registration.

If you're ready to advance your career in a practice that values both your well-being and professional development, we encourage you to connect with us. We look forward to hearing from you! Employment Type: Part-Time
